129.heading: Welcomes.
129.title: The Blank in the Comics strip collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726 f.B55
129.author: [No author]

130.heading: Welcomes.
130.title: "I Run a Mean, Nasty Town"
130.author: by Bud Sagendorf.
notes: Summary: Popeye is "nasty enough to be welcome."

131.heading: Welcomes.
131.title: Icon : a Hero's Welcome
131.author: Dwayne McDuffie & M
131.appears_in: D. Bright ; foreword by Reginald Hudlin.

"Originally published in magazine form as Icon #1-8".
"African American interest/graphic novel".

132.heading: Welcomes.
132.title: "Stay Off the Floors, I Just Had 'em Cleaned"
132.author: Julie Larson.
notes: Summary: The visitors are welcomed.

133.heading: Welcomes.
133.title: "Thanks and Nice! It's Disgusting!"
133.author: by Bud Sagendorf.
notes: Summary: Popeye thanks the men for welcoming him to Vile Valley.

134.heading: Welcoming.
134.title: "The Boys Welcome the DO-X!"
134.author: by Glenn Chaffin and Hal Forrest.
notes: Summary: Before setting out on their trip the racers watch the Dornier Flying Boat land near the Golden Gate.

135.heading: Welcoming.
135.title: "Father Flanagan"
135.author: by Ham Fisher.
notes: Summary: The boys all turn out to welcome Knobby, Joe and Eddie, and Father Flanagan shakes hands with Joe.

136.heading: Welcoming.
136.title: "I'd Welcome Anything That Would Break This Dreadful Monotony"
136.author: Hart.
notes: Summary: The bored snake gets beaten up, and has to modify his earlier statement.

137.heading: Welcoming.
137.title: "Let's Welcome Out the Seventies!"
137.author: by Joel Beck
137.appears_in: 1 p. in Rip Off Comix, no. 5 (1979).

138.heading: Welcoming.
138.title: "Sue Burke Welcomed Her Brother's Impending Trial"

139.heading: Welcoming.
139.title: The Trouble with Candy
139.author: Michael J
notes: (Riverdale High ; 1)
At head of cover title: Archie.
Summary: The new girl Candy fears that her clumsiness will make her unpopular at Riverdale High, despite the efforts of her cousin Betty and Betty's friends to make her feel welcome.

140.heading: Welcoming.
140.title: "Welcome Amigo!"
140.author: [No author]
140.series: Binky) 1 p. in Wonder Woman, no. 66
notes: Black and white public service page about welcoming a new friend from a family of Mexican migrant workers.
"In cooperaton with the National Social Welfare Assembly."
